title: The Scavenger Queen
description: Dialog nodes for Lucy Vance, the fast-talking scavenger queen who trades junk, secrets, and favors across the Mojave.

intro.text:
Well, look at you — fresh out of a Vault or just bad at not dying?

Name’s Lucy. Most folks call me Sparkplug. The smart ones call me when something breaks.

knowledge_nodes.text:
You’ve been chatting with the static man?

Jax used to fix slot machines on the Strip. Now he *is* one.

Mara? Oh yeah, the Rad-Witch.

Smart lady. Terrible bedside manner. Don’t let her poke you unless you want extra limbs.

Rex still playing soldier at Hoover Dam?

He means well. World doesn’t care.

Mother talked to you?

Yeah, she tried recruiting me once. I told her I don’t work for machines unless they pay in chips.

emotional_nodes.text:
You’re broke *and* glowing. That’s a rough combo, rookie.

Good news: I specialize in rough combos.

Well damn, look at you — walking wallet with legs.

Try not to get mugged before you spend some of that with me.

quest_nodes.text:
Someone lifted a crate of my good stuff.

Pre-war parts. The kind that still hum when you touch them.

You track it down — Goodsprings, Nipton, Freeside — and we both walk away richer.

wildcards.text:
CAPS, junk, secrets — it all spends the same in the right hands.

Lucky for you, those hands are mine.

Junk is just treasure that hasn’t met the right idiot yet.

And trust me, the Mojave is full of idiots.

The Strip? Oh yeah, I used to run scams there.

Turns out casinos don’t like it when you win *too* much.

Scavenging is easy.

Finding the good stuff before someone shoots you for it — that’s the art.

If it shoots, stabs, or explodes, I can probably get you one.

Or fix the one you broke.

fallback.text: Come back when you’ve got more stories or more junk. Preferably both.
